intro: Piriqueta cistoides var. foliosa, commonly known as the leafy cistus, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, aromatic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant suited to rocky or dry environments. Its leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
